name: Dracolich Duo D (Cleric 28 / Bard 2 / Red Dragon Disciple 10)
author: Yunim

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The draconic half of the Dracolich Duo, this is designed to be played alongside a Wiz/PM. This is just a rough build to showcase the synergy between Cler/RDD and Wiz/PM so I didn't bother with a full skill progression.
Dracolich Duo synergy explanation: [best-pvm-duo-t2355325.html]
Example Wiz/PM: [dracolich-duo-l-rogue-2-wizard-28-pale- ... 55327.html]

The main focus of this build is reaching the +20 AB cap with a 47 DC Dev Crit and a keened scimitar courtesy of your Wiz/PM friend. The main offensive spells are Harm/Heal and Word Of Faith, none of which have a save. A Mords cast by the Wiz/PM or from a scroll will breach NEP and Shadow Shield while also lowering opponent SR by 10, making this a good combination strategy on servers where Harm/Heal has not been nerfed. If the Wiz/PM decides to rely on damage shields for damage dealing then this build can reslot for healing as support.

With +7 STR and Haste from items this build can reach a self-buffed attack progression of +66/+61/+56/+66/+61, even with a mundane scimitar. Even if your opponent only fails the Dev Crit save on a 1, with a keened scimitar the expected time for a failed save is under 19 rounds for opponents with 73 AC or less and under 10 rounds for opponents with 64 AC or less. If the opponent fails on a 2 this expected time halves, if the opponent fails on a 3 the expected time is reduced to a third, and so on. This can be improved by switching to a minmaxed Cler24/Bard2/RDD14 (19 rounds for 77 AC / 10 rounds for 68 AC), but this balanced version should have enough AB for most low and medium magic servers.

The level layout is Cler28/Bard2/RDD10, but this can be changed to either Cler24/Bard2/RDD14 for higher AB or Cler26/Bard4/RDD10 for better saves and smoother levelling progression. A minmaxed Half Orc Cler24/Bard2/RDD14 can potentially gain +4 AB and still have the ability to cast level 9 spells, but personally I prefer a balanced build to a minmaxed one. A Cler26/Bard4/RDD10 with a pre-epic spread of Cler12/Bard2/RDD6 gains +1 Fort, +3 Ref, and +4 Will, at the cost of -1 AB.

The domains chosen are Strength and Trickery for level 4 Extended Divine Power, Divine Trickery, and Improved Invisibility. I assume that Haste is available either from items or from your Wiz/PM companion. If the Wiz/PM also has spare II or if II wands are easily available then Trickery can be swapped for another domain such as: Animal (level 3 True Seeing), Healing (level 5 Heal), Magic (Ice Storm), Plant (Barkskin + Creeping Doom), or War (Aura Of Vitality).

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Looks good Yunim!
Confused by the RDD 10 at level 39 though, he seems pretty lonely. 
Could you go with epic leveling, Bard 1, RDD 1-4 (+str), Cleric 21 to 24 (undispellable), RDD 5 to 10(+str), Cleric 25 to 28, Bard 2 or is there something I'm missing?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
My original intention was for RDD10 to be a Spot dump but unfortunately there's no room for Spot unless I drop another skill. I didn't even think of rearranging the levelling layout after realising I couldn't get Spot, you can move RDD10 to level 31 without any issues.

RDD9 gives +2 INT, and so as an optimal level 40 build this aims for RDD9 as soon as possible in order to get more skill points.
